title: Selector Forks and Drum - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Make sure that the engine is securely mounted in an engine stand or properly supported when it is removed from the motorcycle.
If the engine is not correctly supported, it can fall.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in damage to property or serious injury.
Input and Output Shaft Assemblies - Removal
Remove and discard the two selector shaft fixings, noting the position of the washer and keeper plate. Note the position of the washer and keeper plate for installation.
Selector drum and input selector shaft keeper plate
Incorrect fitting of the selector forks will cause gearbox damage.
The two output shaft selector forks can be fitted incorrectly.
Mark the position and orientation of the selector forks before removal.
There are identification markings on one side of the fork. These markings must face the alternator side of the engine when installed.
Slide the output selector shaft from the crankcase in the direction of the clutch. Collect the two selector forks as they are released by the selector shaft.
Noting the position of the selector fork, remove the input selector shaft, leaving the selector fork in the gearbox.
Withdraw the selector drum from within the crankcase.
Collect the input shaft selector fork from the crankcase.
